title: Blair Witch Steadi-cam VERTIGO Edition
description:
***DISCLAIMER***

I did this as an experiment; my goal here is not to redistribute copyrighted matrerial, or &#039;pirate&#039; the film.
I&#039;ve made my own, &#039;watchable&#039; version, aimed at someone *really* sensitive to motion sickness. And I&#039;m sharing it as an experiment. Without this, I would not have been able to watch this excellent film. 

Believe me, I tried.


Ok, here&#039;s the deal: 

I have Vertigo, the actual medical condition that causes spells of dizziness, often triggered by motion.

I really wanted to see this movie, but didn&#039;t want to barf, or even take the chance that feeling nauseous would discract from the pace/energy of the film.

So, I "steadied" the entire movie using the excellent virtualdub plugin DeShaker. I highly reccommend it for your own home movies.

Conclusions:

The process actually worked quite well. What you will see, is that because the shooting is so wild/freehand, steadying the content makes the &#039;frame&#039; of the movie swing and rotate in the exact opposite way. If you have a zoom control on your DVD remote, you may want to use it a little to eliminate some of the border swing. You&#039;ll see what I mean when you try it.

That said, this isn&#039;t perfect,  don&#039;t yell at me because its not a perfect rip. That&#039;s not the point. I did this as an experiment, and I&#039;ll tell you what, for me, it actually worked, despite the distraction of the frame moving. Someone with vertigo will actually rather have the frame move than the content. 

You&#039;ll also see things you missed, because the camera now keeps the main subject(s) centered.


Coded with XVID.

Please comment and let me know your thoughts.
